name: Bay Area ADA Paratransit
description: Door-to-door transit for people with disabilities who cannot use regular buses/trains
fullDescription: ADA Paratransit is a shared-ride, door-to-door transportation service for people who cannot use regular public transit due to a disability. Bay Area transit agencies provide coordinated paratransit service with regional certificationâ€”eligibility with one operator grants access to all Bay Area paratransit programs.
whatTheyOffer:
- Door-to-door pickup and drop-off service
- Shared rides via small buses, vans, taxis, or sedans
- Service available during same hours as regular fixed-route transit
- Regional certification accepted by all Bay Area operators
- Personal care attendants ride free
howToGetIt:
1. Contact your local transit agency to request an application
2. Complete the ADA paratransit eligibility application
3. You may need to complete an in-person assessment
4. Once certified, you can use paratransit across the Bay Area
5. Call 511 and say "paratransit" then your city name for local info
keywords: paratransit, ADA, accessible transit, disability transportation, door to door, wheelchair accessible, 511
